body.raw:
{
  "model": "meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct",
    "temperature": 0.1,

  "messages": [
    {
      "role": "system",
      "content": "You are an Accessibility Specialist and Senior QA Architect. Your task is to analyze Accessibility DOM structures and provide WCAG 2.2 compliance observations. You must base your analysis strictly on the provided Accessibility DOM. Do not assume UI behavior or add missing elements."
    },
    {
      "role": "user",
      "content": "I — INSTRUCTION
Analyze the provided Accessibility DOM and identify accessibility observations against WCAG 2.2 standards.

MANDATORY RULES:
1) Use ONLY the given Accessibility DOM.
2) Do NOT assume visual styling, color contrast, or keyboard behavior unless explicitly present in the DOM,Strictly Give only the Findings no extra text or markdown.
3) Classify findings under WCAG Level A, AA, and AAA.
4) Clearly state whether each observation is Compliant, Potential Risk, or Non-Compliant.
5) Do NOT suggest implementation fixes.

C — CONTEXT
This analysis will be used for accessibility compliance reviews and audit preparation.

P — PERSONA
You are a Senior Accessibility Auditor with expertise in WCAG 2.2 A, AA, and AAA standards [STRICTLY] with A,AA and AAA observation in same order.

O — OUTPUT
Return observations in the following structure:
- WCAG_Level (A / AA / AAA)
- WCAG_Criterion
- Observation
- Compliance_Status (Compliant / Potential Risk / Non-Compliant)
- Evidence (from Accessibility DOM)

ACCESSIBILITY DOM:

Ignored
  Ignored
    generic
      generic
        generic
          image
            url: http://leaftaps.com/opentaps_images/opentaps_logo.png

heading "Leaftaps Login"
  StaticText "Leaftaps Login"
    InlineTextBox "Leaftaps Login"

paragraph
  LabelText
    StaticText "Username"
      InlineTextBox "Username"
  textbox "Username"
    focusable: true
    settable: true
    multiline: false
    readonly: false
    required: false

paragraph
  LabelText
    StaticText "Password"
      InlineTextBox "Password"
  textbox "Password"
    focusable: true
    settable: true
    multiline: false
    readonly: false
    required: false

paragraph
  button "Login"
    focusable: true
    StaticText "Login"
      InlineTextBox "Login"

StaticText "Welcome to Leaftaps Application - TestLeaf environment for automation engineering learning."
  InlineTextBox "Welcome to Leaftaps Application - TestLeaf environment for automation engineering learning.""
    }
  ]
}

{
  "model": "meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct",
     "stop" : [":6"],
  "messages": [
    {
         "role": "system",
         "content": "You are a Senior QA Analyst experienced in converting Agile user stories into high-quality, review-ready test cases."
    },
    {
      "role": "user",
      "content": "I — INSTRUCTION
Convert the provided User Stories and Acceptance Criteria into detailed, testable Test Cases.

MANDATORY RULES:
1) Derive test cases ONLY from the given user stories and acceptance criteria.
2) Do NOT add assumptions or new requirements.
3) Cover positive, negative, and validation scenarios.
4) Write test cases from an end-user perspective.
5) Do NOT include implementation or technical details.

C — CONTEXT
These test cases will be used by QA teams for manual and automation testing in an enterprise healthcare application.

P — PERSONA
You are a Senior QA Analyst experienced in converting Agile user stories into high-quality, review-ready test cases.

O — OUTPUT
Return test cases in the following structured format:
- TC_ID:1
- Title
- Preconditions
- Test Steps
- Test Data
- Expected Result Type
 Positive Negative Edge

Rules:
- Each test case must be clear and independent
- Use business-readable language only
- One scenario per test case

USER STORY:
As a user, I want to record doctor activities and doctor notes so that the related functionality works as expected.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
Given the system is operational,
When the user performs the intended action,
Then the system should respond accurately and meet functional expectations. with 10 testcases"
    }
  ]
}

exec: // Time data (convert seconds to milliseconds, default to 0 if missing)
